titles.title: Mäṣḥafä gǝnzät “Book of the Funeral Ritual”

shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Mäṣḥafä gǝnzät “Book of the Funeral Ritual” (fols. 3ra-152ra) - Introduction (fols. 3ra-7rb) - Discourse of St. Athanasius on death (fols. 10va-19vb) - Mäṣḥaf zä-wäḍʾat ʾǝm-ʾIyärusalem “Book that Came from Jerusalem” (fols. 20ra-27va) - Antiphons (kǝśtät, ʾaryam) (fols. 36rb-37ra, 59ra-60ra, 64va-65ra, 66rb-68ra, 73rb-74rb, 75vb, 77vb-78ra, 81ra-rb, 85ra-rb) - Homily by St. Jacob of Serug for the funeral of priests and deacons (fols. 85vb-89vb) - Homily by ʾabba Sälama, Metropolitan of Ethiopia (fols. 104va-106vb) - Lǝfafä ṣǝdq “Bandlet of Righteousness” (fols. 111ra-114rb) - Mängädä sämay “Journey to Heaven” (fols. 114rb-115ra).

copyists.copyist: Gäbrä Wahǝd is mentioned in the colophon as the scribe.

donors.donor: Zä-Wäldä Maryam and his wife Śǝḥinä Śǝllase are mentioned in Additio 1; They are also mentioned in the supplication formulas on many fols., e.g., fols. 8vb, 16rb, 18ra, 30rb, 42vb, 50vb, 96vab. The names of other family members (cf. Additio 1) also occur occasionally, e.g., Wäldä Śǝllase and ʿAmätä Mikaʾel on fols. 58ra, 113ra, Gäbrä Ḥawaryat, Täsfa Śǝllase and Täklä Haymanot on fol. 93vb, ʿƎśśetä Maryam on fol. 133vb.

dcomments.dcomment: šum ʾagame Gäbrä Ḥǝywät is mentioned in Additio 2 as the donor. Perhaps this is šum ʾagame Dästa (d. 1908) whose baptismal name was Gäbrä Ḥǝywät (cf. QQM-004, fol. 131va; SM-007, fol. 142vc).

txstates.txstate: The Ms. shows traces of intensive use. The original leather cover has been covered with a very crudely processed secondary leather layer. The leather cover on the spine has been damaged; several fols. are stained from wax and dirt. Tears or cuts skilfully amended on fols. 31, 32, 54, 56.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with tooled leather (two layers); textile inlay. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather (at least 6 tools were used: triple line fillet, double circle, cross hatching, double sine wave, interlaced fillet, criss-cross).

bnothers.bnother: Remains of two pairs of endband stitches at the spine.

squires.squire: A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – I(6/fols. 3r-8v) – II(6/fols. 9r-14v) – III(6/fols. 15r-20v) – IV(6/fols. 21r-26v) – V(6/fols. 27r-32v) – VI(6/fols. 33r-38v) – VII(6/fols. 39r-44v) – VIII(6/fols. 45r-50v) – IX(6/fols. 51r-56v) – X(6/fols. 57r-62v) – XI(6/fols. 63r-68v) – XII(6/fols. 69r-74v) – XIII(6/fols. 75r-80v) – XIV(6/fols. 81r-86v) – XV(6/fols. 87r-92v) – XVI(6/fols. 93r-98v) – XVII(6/fols. 99r-104v) – XVIII(6/fols. 105r-110v) – XIX(6/fols. 111r-116v) – XX(8/fols. 117r-124v) – XXI(4/fols. 125r-128v) – XXII(8/fols. 129r-136v) – XXIII(4/fols. 137r-139v) – XXIV(8/fols. 140r-148v) – XXV(2/fols. 149r-150v) – B(3; s.l.: 1, no stub/fols. 151r-153v).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; name of the donor; a few lines of the incipit pages of the text, alternating with black lines; incipit of each section of the text; incipit of the colophon; names of Hebrew letters in Ps. 118 (e.g., fols. 39ra, 41rab, 41va); abbreviations; elements of the punctuation signs and text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals; some other words: e.g., wä-kaʿǝbä (e.g., fols. 50rb, 54rb), ṣällǝyu (e.g., fols. 50rb, 96va), halle luya (e.g., fols. 10va, 15va), wä-ʾǝmzǝ (e.,g., fols. 141va, 142rb), wä-tǝbäl (e.g., fols. 52rb, 54rb), wä-yǝbäl (e.g., fols. 142ra, 142va), qǝdmä wangel (e.g., fols. 51va, 75vb).

abbreviations.abbreviation: ይ፡ ሕ፡ for ይበሉ፡ ሕዝብ፡ (e.g., fols. 21rb, 23va) ይ፡ ዲ፡ for ይበል፡ ዲያቆን፡ (e.g., fols. 32ra, 34va) ይ፡ ካ፡ for ይበል፡ ካህን፡ (e.g., fols. 32rab, 34va) ሃ፡ሃ፡ሃ፡ for ሃሌ፡ ሉያ (e.g., fols. 10vb, 11rab, 56rab) ፍ፡ for ፍቱሐ፡ ወንጹሐ፡ ረስዮ፡ ለዝንቱ፡ በድን፡ (e.g., fols. 40vab, 48rab)

colophon.det: The book was completed by the scribe Gäbrä Wahǝd on the 16th of Miyazya in the time of Luke the Evangelist.

additional.det: The note states that the book was donated to the church of Maryam May ʾAbʾa by ʾasallafi Zä-Wäldä Maryam. It also contains a supplication for the donor of the Ms., his wife Śǝḥinä Śǝllase, his parents Wäldä Śǝllase and ʿAmätä Mikaʾel and other relatives (?) and for the scribe. The parts of the note are separated from each other by thin black lines. A list of names follows on fol. 152va-vb, probably also belonging to this note.

additional.cont: Fol. 152vb: Note mentioning gwəlt-land donated to the church.
additional.det: Note that states that gwǝlt-land was donated to the church of Maryam May ʾAbʾa by Zä-Wäldä Maryam in the time of dägiyat Wǝbe and šum ʾagame Gäbrä Ḥǝywät; the end of the note has been erased.

extras.extra: - Crude drawing of a church (?), legend: ʾIyärusalem: fol. 2r. - Names of the relatives of the donor written in the upper margin or interlineally in small script: e.g., fols. 58ra, 89ra, 92ra-b, 113ra. - The word ʾǝgäle is marked above and below by thin lines: e.g., fols. 87va-b, 88ra-b, 88va-b, 90ra, 106vb. - Part of the line is taken up: fol. 65ra. - Omitted letters, words and passages are inserted interlineally or written in the margin on many fols.: e.g., fols. 30vb, 33vb, 37rb, 50va-b, 59ra-b, 74ra-b, 77ra, 96rb. - Immediate corrections marked by dashes above and below the words: fols. 41vb, 78rb. - Corrections written over erasures: 33vb, 42va, 68va. - Erasures: 55rb, 78rb, 80rb, 146va. - Small script: 81r. - The scribe used compressed script: e.g., fols. 36rb-37ra, 59ra-60ra, 64va-65ra. - Scribbles and doodles in the margins on many fols.: e.g., fols. 15v, 17r, 28r, 60r, 67v, 68r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Notes in the upper margin referring to the content of the Ms. on many fols.: e.g., 10v, 20r, 46v, 82r, 100v, 104v, 115r, 125r. - Coloured threads have been inserted in the upper corner of fols. 96, 141.

frames.frame: Fol. 3ra-b (incipit page of the Introduction): elaborate, coloured (red, yellow, turquoise) ornamental band with three lateral extensions reaching the bottom of the page; interlaces. Fol. 5va: short uncoloured ornamental band; interlaces. Fol. 7rb: short uncoloured ornamental band; interlaces. Fol. 8vb: short uncoloured ornamental band; interlaces. Fol. 10va-b (incipit of the Discourse of St. Athanasius on death): coloured (red, yellow, turquoise, black) ornamental band; interlaces; anthropomorphic motifs (human face). Fol. 20ra-b (incipit of Mäṣḥaf zä-wäḍʾat ʾǝm-ʾIyärusalem): coloured (red, white, black) ornamental band; interlaces. Fol. 30va: coloured (red, white, black) ornamental band; interlaces. Fol. 38vb: coloured (red, white, black) ornamental band; interlaces. Fol. 41ra: coloured (red, white, black) ornamental band; interlaces. Fol. 71ra: coloured (red, white, black) ornamental band with short extensions at the edges; interlaces. Fol. 73rb: short, coloured (red, white, black) ornamental band; interlaces. Fol. 76vb: coloured (red, white, black) ornamental band; interlaces. Fol. 77vb: coloured (red) ornamental band. Fol. 79ra: coloured (red, white, black) ornamental band; interlaces. Fol. 81ra: coloured (red) ornamental band. Fol. 82vb: short, coloured (red, white, black) ornamental band; chains. Fol. 84rb: coloured (red) ornamental band; interlaces. Fol. 85ra: short, coloured (red, white, black) ornamental band; interlaces. Fol. 85vb: coloured (red) ornamental band with short extensions at the edges; interlaces.
